\section*{\begin{picture}(20,0) \put(-5,-10){\includegraphics*[width=1cm]{/www/erowid.org/experiences/images/erologo_1cm_600dpi_greyscale}} \end{picture} Erowid Experience Vaults Report Id: 9434}

\subsection*{Don't Waste Your Time}
\vspace{-0.2cm}
by \emph{Dion}
\vspace{0.5cm}
\thispagestyle{plain}

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
Dose:  T+ 0:00 & 400 mg & oral & Pharms - Meclizine & pill / tablet\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1mm}

\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|}
\hline
Body weight: & 235.00 lbs\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{2mm}

Don't waste your time.  I had been prescribed Meclizine for a vestibular disorder, but the vestibular symptoms went away long before my medicine ran out.  When I read that it was called `Dramamine II' and was supposed to have the same effect, I thought perhaps I could use it instead of Dramamine to trip.  After 16 pills - 25 mg each - nothing happened.  I just felt a little light-headed, nothing even close to a `trip'.  If you have some laying around the house, just save it for any time when you're feeling vertigo or general dizziness - it's great for that.  But for tripping?  Forget it.

\end{document}
